title: Orbiting satellites - ratio of asteroid kinetic en

content.question: An asteroid orbits a star in an elliptical path, as shown in the figure. The asteroid is farthest from the star at Point <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>A</mtext></math> and closest to the star at Point <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>B</mtext></math>, and Point <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>A</mtext></math> is twice as far from the center of the star as Point <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>B</mtext></math>. How are the kinetic energies <math alttext="K sub A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>K</mi><mtext>A</mtext></msub></math> and <math alttext="K sub B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>K</mi><mtext>B</mtext></msub></math> of the asteroid at points <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>A</mtext></math> and <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>B</mtext></math>, respectively, related?

choices.label: <math alttext="K sub B equals, one fourth K sub A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>K</mi><mtext>B</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>4</mn></mfrac><msub><mi>K</mi><mtext>A</mtext></msub></math>

<math alttext="K sub B equals, one half K sub A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>K</mi><mtext>B</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac><msub><mi>K</mi><mtext>A</mtext></msub></math>
<math alttext="K sub B equals, 2 K sub A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>K</mi><mtext>B</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><msub><mi>K</mi><mtext>A</mtext></msub></math>
<math alttext="K sub B equals, 4 K sub A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>K</mi><mtext>B</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>4</mn><msub><mi>K</mi><mtext>A</mtext></msub></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="K sub B equals, 4 K sub A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>K</mi><mtext>B</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>4</mn><msub><mi>K</mi><mtext>A</mtext></msub></math>
